meanings.definition: To go in a specified direction, typically slowly or by an indirect route.
meanings.sent1: She decided to wend her way through the forest to reach the hidden lake.
meanings.sent2: The river wends its way through the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel wended its way up the tree trunk, only to realize it was a dead end.
meanings.sent4: Time wends its way through our lives, leaving memories in its wake.
meanings.sent5: As the sun sets, the shadows wend their way across the field, signaling the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: The students wend to their classrooms after the bell rings.
meanings.sent2: After a brief pause, the conversation wends forward to a new topic.
meanings.sent3: The cat wended its way around the furniture, looking for a cozy spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts wend towards the upcoming exam, causing a mix of anxiety and determination.
meanings.sent5: The river wends gently downstream, carrying fallen leaves on its surface.
